definition: to lecture on doctrine/to expound the wisdom of ancient sages/to preach/a sermon
to pass on/to spread/to transmit/to infect/to transfer/to circulate/to conduct (electricity)

road/path/CL:條|条[tiao2],股[gu3]/principle/truth/morality/reason/skill/method/Dao (of Daoism)/to say/to speak/to talk/classifier for long thin things (rivers, cracks etc), barriers (walls, doors etc), questions (in an exam etc), commands, courses in a meal, steps in a process/(old) circuit (administrative division)
to teach (idiom); lit. to give moral and practical instruction

sentences.english: She is the woman who killed her preacher husband in Tennessee.
sentences.chinese: 之前她在田纳西州杀死了她的传道士丈夫。

sentences.english: The words of the Preacher, the son of David, king in Jerusalem.
sentences.chinese: 在耶路撒冷作王，大卫的儿子，传道者的言语。

sentences.english: This peace of God is not a mere abstraction advocated by preachers and theologians.
sentences.chinese: 神的平安并非由传道人和神学家所传扬的抽象概念。

sentences.english: The angel told the evangelist's evangel to a gang of fanged gangling gangsters.
sentences.chinese: 天使把福音传道者的佳音传给一伙有毒牙的瘦长匪徒。

sentences.english: I the Preacher was king over Israel in Jerusalem.
sentences.chinese: 我传道者在耶路撒冷作过以色列的王。

sentences.english: The words of the Teacher, son of David, king in Jerusalem
sentences.chinese: 在耶路撒冷作王，大卫的儿子，传道者的言语。

sentences.english: Toral is also called an Internet “evangelist, ” for good reason.
sentences.chinese: 托拉尔也被称为互联网的“传道者”，这不无道理。

sentences.english: Tolstoy became a kind of prophet in his old age, during the last few decades.
sentences.chinese: 晚年，在其辞世前的一二十年，托尔斯泰象个传道者。

sentences.english: He called the disciples together and then sent them to preach to the people.
sentences.chinese: 他把门徒召集到一起，然后差派他们去传道。

sentences.english: Most academics spend some of their time imparting knowledge as well.
sentences.chinese: 许多学者也会花时间传道授业。

sentences.english: While they preached if any one tried to harm them they got burnt.
sentences.chinese: 当他们传道时若有人要伤害他们就被火烧灭。

sentences.english: And, when you preach, you've got to reprove your people.
sentences.chinese: 而且，在你传道时，你要责备你的百姓。

sentences.english: He was one of the earliest apostles of collectivistic nationalism in Germany.
sentences.chinese: 他是德国最早的集体主义的民族主义的传道者之一。

sentences.english: Jens Lehmann is returning to Arsenal to pass on his eccentricity to the Gunners' next generation of stars.
sentences.chinese: 莱曼将回归阿森纳为下一代的枪手们传道授业解惑。

sentences.english: The preacher sought to find out acceptable words: and that which was written was upright, even words of truth.
sentences.chinese: 传道者专心寻求可喜悦的言语，是凭正直写的诚实话。

sentences.english: I, the Teacher, was king over Israel in Jerusalem.
sentences.chinese: 我传道者在耶路撒冷作过以色列的王。

definition: to pass on doctrines from master to disciple (Buddhism)
to pass on scripture/to teach Confucian doctrine/to pass on one's experience
God (in Catholicism)/abbr. for 天主教[Tian1 zhu3 jiao4], Catholicism
